answers.answer: I gained about the same amount and my doctor says my weight is fine. I was 130 before getting preg. but I think it depends on how much you weigh before pregnancy that determines how much you should gain. But women gain different amounts of weight with different pregnancy. My sister in law gained 55lbs with her first two and only 25 with her third. As for a repeat pap. No I didnt have to have one but have known someone who has and everything was fine. I am sure it will be the same with you Try not to worry

as far as teh weight is concerned, they only want you to gain 25-30 pounds throughout your entire pregnancy.  as far as teh "why's" are concerned, Im not exactly sure.  I do know that the more weight you gain, the baby will be bigger as well.Have you had your diabetes tests yet?  I know gestational diabetes can cause increased weight.  How is your blood pressures?  increased weight can also have an affect on your swelling/blood pressures which is unhealthy.  All in all, eat when your hungry and waht you want, just dont overindulge.  They say they want you to gain no more than a pound a week.  When I was still on my 4 week appointment shifts, i gained 7 pounds in a four week appt and my doctor said "dont do that again".  however, 4 weeks later, I didnt gain a pound, so the weight can be just coming "off cycle" if that makes sense.

I think they worry about gestational diabetes.My doctor is constantly going on about my weight. I have gained 30 lbs altogether so far and I am at 35 weeks, but when I was at 28 weeks I was more or less the same as you.I have been told to eliminate bread and pasta and cakes from my diet (which I managed to do for a week, as I got scared due to a Placenta problem), but I have since been given the all clear and have been trying to eat normal, but I find myself constantly hungry.As to your worries about sleeping, you will wake up if there is a problem (she will let it be known to you).Sometimes a Pap test has to be repeated when certain cells come back adnormal, and they may repeat it upto 3 times, so again standard procedure.

I am in the same boat as you, only worse.  As of today I have gained 35 lbs. UGH!!!  I also wake up on my back and stomach sometimes and wonder if she is OK. I think the babies are fine-you can't help what you do in your sleep.  As far as the weight gain I don't know what to say because I am doing worse than you. I don't overeat and it has always been hard for me to maintain my weight. I seem to be filled with alot of fluid because my ankles really swell. Good luck to you, I know it is soooo hard to not gain too much weight! :)

My gd test was fine. I made it a point to ask because, they wont mention anything unless it's bad. I also just happned to ask about my blood pressure (I never have) and she said so far I've been normal.I was curious about my GD test because I've heard that more than likely women who do get GD will also get regular diabetes in a few years. It runs in my family so I was worried.I really dont know how to eat now.  Prepregnancy, I would take in between 1300-about 1800 calories a day. So now that I cant and dont have to eat like that, I just sorta eat what I want when I'm hungry.

I know what you mean.  I dont think I eat so terribly to be gaining all this weight. I know I eat more than before, my appetite is a lot bigger than before. But I occasionally have the really bad stuff like candy and ice cream and cakes. It's just the food I guess I eat to much of.

Hey girl,you and I are neck and neck. At my 28 week weigh in, I was 25 pounds too... lolAlthough I think their scale sucks. My scale says 21.6 pounds. And I weigh myself every morning naked, so I think I'm right.I'm still waiting to fing out about GD, but since they haven't called I'm assuming that everything is okay.I don't cheat a lot either and I actually feel better when I have sugar. I find if I don't have it for a day or two that I get really dizzy and sick like. Maybe I'm the kind that needs chocolate.. :)

Well you know I am 28 weeks at at my last appt I was up to 35lbs.  My next appt is on Monday and I am sure I am up to at least 40lbs.I know people who gained over 60.  It is hard, I used to watch everything I ate before I got pregnant and only ate/drink Diet everything.  Now you cant eat/drink Diet anything so it adds on fast.I am not worrying about the weight until after.  People really overweight have healthy babies.  Everybody's bodies are different.You will be ok.

oh and yes, I had repeat paps done twice already because I declined a colposcopy early on in pregnancy when the first pap came back funny.  The weird thing is all the other paps are coming back normal.  :)

Thats funny that you say the scales are wrong becasue every time I weighh myself it seems as if it's a little less than what they get. True I use a digital and the use one of those old ones that you have to do manually. I think I might be hitting it more on with the digital.

I think your weight gain sounds fine.  Most of my frieds gained way more than that, including a friend who is a personal trainer and is uberfit.  She gained about 40 pounds with each of her four kids.

Some women are just pre-disposed to gaining more weight.  I'm at the end of my pregnancy (due any time now) and I've gained 27 pounds total, which is the most out of all three of my pregnancies.  My sister, however, gained quite a few more.As far as gestational diabetes is concerned, women who have them are at a risk of keeping it after pregnancy, but I believe the incidence is low.  Since it runs in your family, I'd keep an eye on it.  When they check your urine at the doctors office, they look for ketones which is another marker for diabetes...Your doctor's office doesnt sound like very informative people.  Id come right out and ask them what the effects of gaining too much weight are.  Im not sure why, but I know its a "no-no".  I think they dont want you to gain that much more for your own health than the baby's.  If you gain too much, there are complications.I'm gonna do some research on it and see what I find.  Ill post back anything I come up wtih.  In the meantime, dont stress yourself out about it.

I think your weight gain sounds fine.  Most of my frieds gained way more than that, including a friend who is a personal trainer and is uberfit.  She gained about 40 pounds with each of her four kids.
I'm praying for a normal pap. I would be thrilled!
Good luck with your Pap, I hope everything is fine this time!! :)

question: I'm wondering if what I'm feeling is common.  I woke up this morning feeling SO guilty.  I had a dr. appointment yesterday and came out of it sorta depressed. She told me that i've gained to much weight so far.  I've gained 25 lbs and I'm 28 weeks. Will to much weight gain affect the baby in anyway? I'm disappointed in myself. Is the extra weight just something that will set ME back personally, but not affect her in anyway?  I'm just wondering what would make her bring it up. She asked if I eat a lot of sweets which, I really dont. Just food sometimes that is probably not the best for us.Also, I feel guilty because I've started to go into deep sleeps again (like the 1st trimester).  I wake up scared to death that I did something bad in my sleep that might affect her (sleep on my belly & back).  I dont remember anything throughout the night.I know it may sound stupid to some but, this is something i deal with all the time.  I feel like a bad mother already. I woke up on my back last night.  I must have been there for a long time. Then when I moved to my left, she started to kick up a storm. She probably didnt have enough room?Also, My dr. told me that I have to have a repeat pap at my next visit. I will be 31 weeks by then. I'm just curious to know if anyone else has to have a repeat pap also?  The first one came back abnormal, they did a colposcopy and basically, I know nothing about what's going on.  So why the second pap if she says she's may have to do a byopsy after the baby is here? Isn't it definetly going to come out abnormal again?
title: Severe guilt / repeat pap at 31 weeks/ weight gain/ OPEN
